title: Tottenham defender Toby Alderweireld confident ahead of Liverpool trip despite miserable form
text:
Toby Alderweireld has insisted Tottenham are not daunted by their upcoming trip to Liverpool despite their troubling form.

Tottenham have won just one of their previous seven games after labouring to a 1-1 draw against rock-bottom Watford on Saturday.

Mauricio Pochettino's men needed a late goal from Dele Alli - his first since January - to avoid another embarrassing defeat.

Toby Alderweireld insisted Tottenham are confident ahead of their trip to unbeaten Liverpool

Things do not appear to be getting any easier for Tottenham with their Champions League group game against Red Star Belgrade on Tuesday followed by a trip to Anfield, but Alderweireld is determined to remain positive.

'You can see it two ways,' said Alderweireld. 'It's a big opportunity for us on Tuesday. We must use that.

'Then Sunday is a big opportunity. Look, we're a team, let's go again. Let's go, like that second half. Our best, it's all we can do.'

Dele Alli scored a late equaliser to stop Tottenham from losing against Watford on Saturday

Under-fire boss Mauricio Pochettino, meanwhile, refused to say whether the club would delve into the January transfer market to solve any of their problems.

'I am clear with you. I don't say yes or no,' he said after the draw. 'I don't say we are going to sign or not sign, sell or not sell.

'It is not the moment to talk, when the time arrives we are going to take that decision in one way or another.

'Now is the time to stay all together, all of the squad, with the staff and the fans and try and change the atmosphere.

Mauricio Pochettino remained coy when asked if he'd sign players in January amid struggles

'We are not going to get any benefit to talk about January, it is too far away, we have got a lot of games to play.

'That is the structure of the club that is working and thinking and they need to be ready if we need to do something, if not we keep going, but I am happy with the squad, I am happy with the players.

'Like always, what is going to happen in January I cannot guess today, what happens will happen.'
description: Things do not appear to be getting any easier for Spurs with a Champions League game against Red Star Belgrade followed by a trip to Anfield, but Alderweireld is determined to remain positive.
